alert.note: Alert for Callahan; Coleman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 5:25AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN CALLAHAN AND NORTHWESTERN COLEMAN COUNTIES THROUGH 615 AM CDT... At 525 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Novice, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Novice, Oplin, Goldsboro, and Lake Coleman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in San Angelo.
